text: Anne Edwige Maria Peichert (born 26 November 1996), known by her stage name Louane Emera or simply Louane, is a French singer, songwriter, and actress. In 2013 she took part in The Voice: la plus belle voix, she reached the semi- final of the competition. She represented France at the Eurovision Song Contest 2025 with the song "Maman", where she finished seventh with 230 points. ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== Title Details Peak chart positions Sales Certifications FRA BEL (Fl) BEL (Wa) GER SWI Chambre 12 * Released: 2 March 2015 * Formats: CD, digital download, LP * Label: Fontana, Mercury, Universal 1 92 1 22 6 * BEA: Platinum * IFPI SWI: Gold * SNEP: 2× Diamond Louane * Released: 10 November 2017 * Formats: CD, digital download, LP * Label: Fontana, Mercury, Universal 1 61 2 53 4 * FRA: 500,000 * BEA: Gold * SNEP: Diamond Joie de vivre * Released: 23 October 2020 * Formats: CD, digital download, LP * Label: Fontana, Mercury, Universal 6 135 6 92 9 * SNEP: Platinum Sentiments * Released: 9 December 2022 * Formats: CD, digital download, LP * Label: Fontana, Mercury, Universal 9 — 18 — 24 * SNEP: Platinum Solo * Released: 25 October 2024 * Formats: CD, digital download, LP * Label: Fontana, Mercury, Universal 8 — 21 — 61 "—" denotes a recording that did not chart or was not released in that territory. ===Compilation albums=== Title Details Peak chart positions FRA BEL (Wa) Tiens mon best of * Released: 9 May 2025 * Formats: CD, digital download * Label: Fontana, Mercury, Universal 6 73 ===Extended plays=== Title Details Peak chart positions FRA Avenir * Released: 1 December 2014 * Formats: Digital download * Label: Fontana, Mercury, Universal 198 ===Singles=== ====As lead artist==== Title Year Peak chart positions Certifications Album FRA AUT BEL (Fl) BEL (Wa) GER LTU Peak chart positions for singles in Lithuania: * For "Maman": POL Peak chart positions for singles in Poland: * For "Avenir": SWE SWI UK Down.
